metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8602 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The .sethalftone5 function in psi/zht2.c in Ghostscript before 9.21 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted Postscript document that calls .sethalftone5 with an empty operand stack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8602` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ghostscript - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.2
ghostscript-x - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.2
libgs9 - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.2
libgs9-common - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ghostscript package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.2').
